data.text: @Crimealytics @NOLACityCouncil So that’s about .0001% of the state’s population- why is this even news?  Let’s stop the fear porn and move on. And I’ll wait for an apology on all these useless mandates that we were subject to.
@Crimealytics Where do we see the # of tests and at what point are we doing too few tests to get a clear picture of pandemic spread in Orleans (idk how the sampling is done, etc.)?

@Crimealytics Anecdotally, I know many people that tested positive this weekend after Mardi Gras. With all the home tests, not sure how much that will show up in state data. But again, just personal anecdote.
@Crimealytics Okay. Is there a big drop in testing because of people using at-home tests?
